title: WCAS SOCIOL 376-0-21 Topics in Sociological Analysis
class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Only one unit towards major

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: How does family life vary around the globe? This class will consider marriage, childrearing, intergenerational relationship, and household organization in a comparative perspective. These topics will be explored in a seminar format with the focus on discussion of recently published scholarly books and articles. Throughout the quarter, students will conduct independent research on family life in a country of their choice, and they will present their findings at the end of the term.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Open to sociology majors and minors during preregistration. All undergraduates may register during regular registration beginning February 22.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Upon successful completion of this course, students should be able to
1) describe some of the ways that family life is changing across the globe;
2) explain some of the hypothesized explanations for family change;
3) critique social science research on families;
4) conduct an independent research project using social science research methods and drawing on the scholarly research literature.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: class participation; presentations; readings; research project; seminar; writing assignments

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance 10%; Class participation 15%; Final paper 40%; Presentation 5%; Writing assignments 30%
